Bit.name: search cardinal direction lightmaps on failure
extension of parent
Bit.description: object passes all function values to parent and uses parent's markers

Bit.name: use static massive lightmap sample
Bit.description: cast A LOT of rays once and store the results for lighting

Bit.name: attach to clusters by dynamic sphere
Bit.description: use this for the mac gun on spacestation

Bit.name: effects created by this object do not spawn objects in multiplayer
prophet is not displayed in pegasus builds

Real.name: dynamic light sphere radius
Real.description: sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

Bit.name: invert
Bit.description: result of function is one minus actual result

Bit.name: mapping does not controls active
Bit.description: the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive

Bit.name: always active
Bit.description: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

Bit.name: random time offset
Bit.description: function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1

StringId.name: turn off with
StringId.description: if the specified function is off, so is this function

Real.name: min value
Real.description: function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

Explanation.name: Applying collision damage
Explanation.description: for things that want to cause more or less collision damage

Real.name: Apply collision damage scale
Real.description: 0 means 1. 1 is standard scale. Some things may want to apply more damage

Explanation.name: Game collision damage parameters
Explanation.description: 0 - means take default value from globals.globals

Explanation.name: Absolute collision damage parameters
Explanation.description: 0 - means take default value from globals.globals

StringId.name: variant name
StringId.description: if empty, may be used by any model variant

Bit.name: blend in hsv
Bit.description: blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space

Bit.name: ...more colors
Bit.description: blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

Real.name: distance of evade anim
Real.description: this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our evade animation to move us

Real.name: distance of dive anim
Real.description: this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our dive animation to move us

Real.name: stunned movement threshold
Real.description: if we take this much damage in a short space of time we will play our 'stunned movement' animations

TagReference.name: spawned turret character
TagReference.description: automatically created character when this unit is driven

ShortBounds.name: spawned actor count
ShortBounds.description: number of actors which we spawn

Real.name: spawned velocity
Real.description: velocity at which we throw spawned actors

StringId.name: right_hand_node
StringId.description: where the primary weapon is attached

StringId.name: left_hand_node
StringId.description: where the seconday weapon is attached (for dual-pistol modes)

StringId.name: preferred_gun_node
StringId.description: if found, use this gun marker

ShortInteger.name: variant number
ShortInteger.description: variant number to use this dialogue with (must match the suffix in the permutations on the unit's model)

Bit.name: first person camera slaved to gun.
ai firing disabled by max acceleration

RealFraction.name: listener interpolation factor
RealFraction.description: how far to interpolate listener position from camera to occupant's head

Bit.name: first person camera slaved to gun.
ai firing disabled by max acceleration

RealFraction.name: listener interpolation factor
RealFraction.description: how far to interpolate listener position from camera to occupant's head

Bit.name: first person camera slaved to gun.
ai firing disabled by max acceleration

Real.name: turnover time
Real.description: how much time it takes to evict a rider from a flipped vehicle

RealFraction.name: listener interpolation factor
RealFraction.description: how far to interpolate listener position from camera to occupant's head

Explanation.name: speed dependant turn rates
Explanation.description: when the unit velocity is 0, the yaw/pitch rates are the left values at [max speed reference], the yaw/pitch rates are the right values. the max speed reference is what the code uses to generate a clamped speed from 0..1 the exponent controls how midrange speeds are interpreted.

Explanation.name: entry fields
Explanation.description: note: the entry radius shouldn't exceed 3 world units, as that is as far as the player will search for a vehicle to enter.

Real.name: entry radius
Real.description: how close to the entry marker a unit must be

Angle.name: entry marker cone angle
Angle.description: angle from marker forward the unit must be

Angle.name: entry marker facing angle
Angle.description: angle from unit facing the marker must be

Bit.name: first person camera slaved to gun.
ai firing disabled by max acceleration

RealFraction.name: ping scale
RealFraction.description: nathan is too lazy to make pings for each seat.

Real.name: turnover time
Real.description: how much time it takes to evict a rider from a flipped vehicle

RealFraction.name: listener interpolation factor
RealFraction.description: how far to interpolate listener position from camera to occupant's head

Explanation.name: speed dependant turn rates
Explanation.description: when the unit velocity is 0, the yaw/pitch rates are the left values at [max speed reference], the yaw/pitch rates are the right values. the max speed reference is what the code uses to generate a clamped speed from 0..1 the exponent controls how midrange speeds are interpreted.

Explanation.name: entry fields
Explanation.description: note: the entry radius shouldn't exceed 3 world units, as that is as far as the player will search for a vehicle to enter.

Real.name: entry radius
Real.description: how close to the entry marker a unit must be

Angle.name: entry marker cone angle
Angle.description: angle from marker forward the unit must be

Angle.name: entry marker facing angle
